law.text:
As used in KRS 209.400 and 209.420, unless the context otherwise requires:
"Physically disabled adult" means a person, eighteen (18) years of age or older, with a physical condition, whether congenital or acquired, which constitutes a substantial disability to that person and is demonstrable by medically accepted clinical or laboratory diagnostic techniques.
"Senior citizen" means a person sixty (60) years of age or older;
"Statewide senior and physically disabled adult discount program" means a program to provide senior and physically disabled adults discounts on retail goods and services from merchants throughout the state.
law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 248, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1990. -- Amended 1988 Ky. Acts ch. 51, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1988. -- Created 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 238, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1980; and ch. 406, sec. 2, effective July 15, 1980.
